title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that diminishing marginal returns begin with the third worker and/or does not explain that the marginal product (MP) of the 3rd worker (5) is less than the MP of the 2nd worker (6).
The response states that diminishing marginal returns begin with the third worker and explains that the marginal product (MP) of the 3rd worker (5) is less than the MP of the 2nd worker (6).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the marginal revenue product of the seventh worker as $10 and/or does not show the work.

MRP = P×MP = $10×1 = $10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D19@

The response calculates the marginal revenue product of the seventh worker as $10 and shows the work.

MRP = P×MP = $10×1 = $10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D19@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that 4 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 4th worker ($40) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($35), but the MRP of the 5th worker ($30) is less than the MRC ($35).

The response states that 4 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and explains that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 4th worker ($40) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($35), but the MRP of the 5th worker ($30) is less than the MRC ($35).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will increase and explains that an increase in the productivity of workers will increase the demand for labor in the market for welders.

· States that the wage rate Mateo’s Metalworks will pay will increase and explains that the increase in the market demand for labor will increase the market wage, which increases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will increase and explains that an increase in the productivity of workers will increase the demand for labor in the market for welders.

· States that the wage rate Mateo’s Metalworks will pay will increase and explains that the increase in the market demand for labor will increase the market wage, which increases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will increase and explains that an increase in the productivity of workers will increase the demand for labor in the market for welders.

· States that the wage rate Mateo’s Metalworks will pay will increase and explains that the increase in the market demand for labor will increase the market wage, which increases the wage rate paid by the firm because the firm is a wage taker.
